item.title: 软银集团将以 65 亿美元收购 Ampere Computing 公司
item.description: 软银集团公司（SoftBank Group Corp）周三表示，将以全现金交易方式收购领先的独立芯片设计公司 Ampere Computing，交易价值为 65 亿美元。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp said on Wednesday it will acquire Ampere Computing, a leading independent silicon design company, in an all-cash transaction valued at $6.5 billion.】

item.title: 澳大利亚支持 Vocus 以 33 亿美元收购 TPG Telecom 的光纤和固定资产
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构周四批准了电信公司 Vocus 以 52.5 亿澳元（33.4 亿美元）收购当地竞争对手 TPG Telecom 的企业、政府和批发固定业务及光纤网络资产的交易。【原文：Australia's competition watchdog on Thursday approved telco Vocus' A$5.25 billion ($3.34 billion) takeover of local rival TPG Telecom's enterprise, government and wholesale fixed business and fibre network assets.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：雪佛龙首席执行官寻求更多时间结束委内瑞拉业务
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道，美国石油巨头雪佛龙公司（Chevron）正在游说华盛顿允许其有更多的时间来结束在委内瑞拉的业务。【原文：U.S. oil giant Chevron is lobbying Washington to allow more time to wind down its operations in Venezuela, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔：关税将推迟通胀进程，评估影响为时尚早
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周三表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）提高关税将推迟今年在降低通胀方面取得的进展，但美联储的基本判断是，与关税相关的价格影响将是短暂的，很快就会在经济中发挥作用。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Wednesday that President Donald Trump's tariff increases would delay progress in bringing down inflation this year, but the Fed's base case is that tariff-related price impacts will be transitory, working through the economy quickly.】

item.title: 保诚集团 2024 年利润增长，得益于亚非增长强劲和更多的代理商
item.description: 英国保诚集团（Prudential PLC）周四公布，2024 财年调整后税前营业利润增长，原因是这家专注于亚洲的保险公司受益于亚洲和非洲各业务部门的强劲表现。【原文：Prudential PLC , posted a rise in adjusted operating profit before tax for fiscal 2024 on Thursday, as the Asia-focused insurer benefited from strong performance across business segments in Asia and Africa.】

item.title: 陪审团称，绿色和平组织必须就 "站岩 "抗议活动向管道公司赔偿近 6.67 亿美元
item.description: 陪审团周三表示，绿色和平组织必须向一家总部位于得克萨斯州的管道公司支付近 6.67 亿美元的赔偿金，因为该环保倡导组织在 2016-2017 年抗议北达科他州达科他输油管道（Dakota Access Pipeline）的活动中扮演了重要角色。【原文：Greenpeace must pay a Texas-based pipeline company nearly $667 million in damages for the environmental advocacy group’s role in 2016-2017 protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline in North Dakota, a jury said Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国司法部称丰田子公司日野汽车因排放欺诈被罚 16 亿美元
item.description: 美国司法部周三在一份声明中说，日本汽车制造商丰田公司的一家子公司在承认参与多年的排放欺诈计划后，将面临 16 亿美元的处罚。【原文：A subsidiary of Japanese carmaker Toyota faces $1.6 billion in penalties after pleading guilty to having engaged in a multi-year emissions fraud scheme, the U.S. Justice Department said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 埃克森公司就拟议修改燃料运输条款向殖民地管道公司提出挑战
item.description: 一份文件显示，埃克森美孚周三提交了一份抗议通知，要求监管机构阻止 Colonial 管道公司修改燃料运输条款的提议，理由是可能会对托运人和消费者造成损害。【原文：ExxonMobil filed a protest notice on Wednesday asking regulators to block Colonial Pipeline's proposed changes in fuel shipping terms, citing potential harm to shippers and consumers, a filing showed.】

item.title: Microchip Technology 宣布 13.5 亿美元可转换股票发行计划后股价下跌
item.description: 芯片制造商 Microchip Technology 宣布计划通过发行 13.5 亿美元的可转换股票来筹集资金，该公司股价周三下跌超过 3%。【原文：Shares of Microchip Technology fell more than 3% on Wednesday after the chipmaker announced plans to raise capital by offering $1.35 billion of convertible stock.】

item.title: 新西兰第四季度经济增长，摆脱衰退
item.description: 尽管全球贸易紧张局势仍可能对未来一年构成风险，但新西兰经济在第四季度实现了增长，预示着其在 2024 年中期陷入衰退后的前景正在好转。【原文：New Zealand's economy grew in the fourth quarter, signaling an improving outlook after it sank into a recession in the middle of 2024, though global trade tensions may still pose a risk for the year ahead.】

item.title: 加州大学因预计特朗普削减开支而冻结招聘
item.description: 加利福尼亚大学校长周三表示，该校已在全系统范围内冻结招聘，并进行了额外的裁员，以努力减轻联邦资金大幅削减所带来的影响。【原文：The University of California has imposed a system-wide hiring freeze and made additional cuts, its president said on Wednesday, as part of efforts to try to mitigate the impact of sharp cuts in federal funding.】

item.title: 自由亚洲电台终止赠款后大部分员工休无薪假
item.description: 美国政府资助的自由亚洲电台周三告诉数百名驻美员工，他们将从本周末开始休无薪假，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府表示将终止对该电台的拨款。【原文：The U.S. government-funded Radio Free Asia told hundreds of U.S.-based staff on Wednesday they will be put on unpaid leave from the end of this week after President Donald Trump's administration said it was terminating the outlet's grant funding.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官称公司未被要求收购英特尔股份
item.description: 英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）周三表示，英伟达公司尚未就收购英特尔公司股份一事进行接触。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said on Wednesday that his company has not been approached about purchasing a stake in Intel .】

item.title: 交易日：鲍威尔重提 "过渡性"，市场飙升
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 耐克因需求停滞而出现 5 年来最严重的收入下滑
item.description: 由于耐克的新产品未能打开美国人的钱包，他们不愿购买体育用品和服装等非必需品，预计耐克将在本周四发布的季度财报中公布近五年来最大幅度的收入下滑。【原文：Nike is expected to post its steepest revenue decline in nearly five years in its quarterly results on Thursday, as its new products failed to open the wallets of Americans reluctant to snap up non-essential items like sporting goods and clothing.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，CoreWeave 将在首次公开募股中要求每股 47 至 55 美元的价格
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周三表示，由英伟达（Nvidia）支持的人工智能初创公司 CoreWeave 计划在本周开始首次公开募股营销时，要求投资者为每股股票支付 47 至 55 美元。【原文：CoreWeave, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Nvidia , is planning to ask investors to pay $47 to $55 for each of its shares when it begins marketing its initial public offering this week, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 数据显示，1月份外国持有的美国国债保持稳定
item.description: 美国财政部周三公布的数据显示，1月份外国持有的美国国债数量保持稳定。【原文：Foreign holdings of U.S. Treasuries held steady in January, data from the Treasury Department showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国国家航空航天局可能要求波音公司的 "星际客机 "进行第三次无人驾驶测试
item.description: 波音公司的 "星际客机"（Starliner）太空舱去年在国际空间站上留下了两名美国国家航空航天局（NASA）宇航员，在再次搭载宇航员之前，波音公司可能需要进行第三次无人试飞，美国国家航空航天局的官员说，该太空船的第一批乘员本周必须乘坐 SpaceX 公司的太空舱返回地球。【原文：Boeing's troubled Starliner capsule that left two NASA astronauts on the International Space Station last year may need to fly a third uncrewed test flight before it carries astronauts again, agency officials said as the spacecraft's first crew had to return to Earth on a SpaceX capsule this week.】

item.title: 美国律师事务所Paul Weiss因特朗普行政命令被客户解雇
item.description: 律师事务所保罗-魏斯（Paul Weiss）周三在一份法庭文件中表示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）本月发布了针对该事务所的行政命令，一名面临刑事贿赂指控的前高管已解雇了该事务所作为其辩护律师的职位。【原文：Law firm Paul Weiss said in a court filing on Wednesday that a former executive facing criminal bribery charges has fired it as his defense counsel because of U.S. President Donald Trump's executive order this month targeting the firm.】

item.title: 独家报道美国拟对中国造船征收港口费 开始扼杀煤炭和农产品出口
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）计划通过对与中国有联系的船舶访问美国港口征收巨额费用来重振美国造船业，这一计划正在导致美国煤炭库存膨胀，并激化陷入困境的农业市场的不确定性，因为出口商正在努力寻找船只将货物运往国外。【原文：President Donald Trump's plan to revive U.S. shipbuilding using massive fees on China-linked ship visits to American ports is causing U.S. coal inventories to swell and stoking uncertainty in the embattled agriculture market, as exporters struggle to find ships to send goods abroad.】

item.title: 美国客运铁路公司 Amtrak 首席执行官突然下台
item.description: Amtrak 首席执行官斯蒂芬-加德纳（Stephen Gardner）周三表示，在担任美国客运铁路公司负责人四年多之后，他将立即卸任，理由是担心该公司无法继续得到唐纳德-特朗普总统政府的支持。【原文：Amtrak CEO Stephen Gardner said Wednesday he will step down immediately after more than four years as head of the U.S. passenger railroad, citing concerns about maintaining the carrier's support from President Donald Trump's administration.】

item.title: 瑞银首席执行官称更好的预警有助于提高银行业的安全性
item.description: 瑞士联合银行 瑞银集团首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）周三敦促有关部门提高发现银行问题的能力，同时他还试图就瑞士信贷（Credit Suisse）于 2023 年倒闭后瑞士银行业的整顿工作寻求共识。【原文：UBS CEO Sergio Ermotti on Wednesday urged authorities to improve their ability to detect problems at banks as he sought to find common ground over efforts to overhaul the Swiss banking sector following the 2023 demise of Credit Suisse.】

item.title: 亚马逊在与卢森堡创纪录的 8.12 亿美元隐私罚款的法庭斗争中败诉
item.description: 根据卢森堡隐私监管机构网站上的一份声明，四年前，该机构曾对亚马逊处以创纪录的 7.46 亿欧元（约合 8.124 亿美元）罚款。【原文：Amazon lost its fight against a record 746 million euro ($812.4 million) fine handed out by Luxembourg's privacy regulator four years ago as a court sided with the watchdog, according to a statement on the regulator's website.】

item.title: 消息人士称，赛峰集团提出出售北美部门，以赢得欧盟对柯林斯公司交易的许可
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士周三表示，法国发动机和飞机设备制造商赛峰集团已提出出售其在北美的一项业务，作为一种补救措施，以消除欧盟对其18亿美元竞购柯林斯宇航公司飞行控制业务的担忧。【原文：French engine and aircraft equipment maker Safran has offered the sale of a business in North America which it agreed in December, as a remedy to address EU concerns about its $1.8 billion bid for Collins Aerospace's flight controls business, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 即时观点：美联储维持利率不变，4 月放缓量化宽松步伐
item.description: 美联储周三如期维持利率稳定，但美国央行决策者表示，在经济增长放缓、最终导致通胀下滑的背景下，他们仍预计在今年年底前将借贷成本降低半个百分点。【原文：The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday, as expected, but U.S. central bank policymakers indicated they still anticipate reducing borrowing costs by half a percentage point by the end of this year in the context of slowing economic growth and, eventually, a downturn in inflation.】

item.title: JBS 谋求两地股票上市给 BNDES 带来困境
item.description: 巴西肉类加工企业 JBS 谋求在美国上市的决定使其第二大股东--国家开发银行（BNDES）的投资部门成为关注焦点，该公司的举动是否与该银行促进巴西企业发展的核心使命相冲突。【原文：Brazilian meat processor JBS' decision to pursue a U.S. listing has shone a spotlight on its No. 2 shareholder, National Development Bank's (BNDES) investment arm, and whether the company's move clashed with the bank's core mission of fostering Brazilian corporate development.】

item.title: 美联储决策者预计今年降息两次，部分人认为会更少
item.description: 美国央行行长们周三表示，他们很可能在今年晚些时候降息两个季度，与三个月前的预测中值相同，尽管他们预测经济增长放缓、通胀率上升。【原文：U.S. central bankers on Wednesday signaled they are likely to deliver two quarter-point interest-rate cuts later this year, the same median forecast as three months ago, even as they forecast slower economic growth and higher inflation.】

item.title: 美联储表示将放缓资产负债表的清算进程
item.description: 美联储周三表示，由于在取消政府借贷限额问题上持续陷入僵局，美联储在评估市场流动性方面面临挑战，因此美联储将降低其仍然庞大的资产负债表的缩减速度。【原文：The Federal Reserve said on Wednesday that it will reduce the pace of the drawdown of its still-massive balance sheet, as it faces challenges in assessing market liquidity during an ongoing impasse over lifting the government’s borrowing limit.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Brookfield 在收购 Colonial 管道公司的竞争中处于领先地位
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）正在成为收购殖民管道公司（Colonial Pipeline）的领跑者，包括债务在内，这笔交易对该管道运营商的估值可能达到或超过 100 亿美元。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management is emerging as the frontrunner to acquire Colonial Pipeline, in a deal that could value the pipeline operator at $10 billion or more including debt, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Synopsys 为人工智能 "代理 "设计计算机芯片制定战略
item.description: 生产半导体设计软件的 Synopsys 公司周三推出了一项技术，该公司称这项技术将为计算机取代许多新计算机芯片的制造工作铺平道路。【原文：Synopsys , which makes software used to design semiconductors, on Wednesday introduced a technology it said will pave the way toward computers taking over many of the tasks in creating new computer chips.】
